items.title: This new Honeywell Home smart thermostat can answer your Ring doorbell
items.summary: Resideo’s newest thermostat looks like a compelling alternative to Nest or Ecobee if you’re looking for a premium smart thermostat. The Honeywell Home X8S is compatible with Matter, supports room sensors, and features a sleek 5-inch touchscreen that works as an intercom for Ring and First Alert video doorbells. items.title: Greek farmers expand blockades as protests intensify nationwide
items.summary: ATHENS, Dec. 3 (Xinhua) -- Farmers across Greece intensified their protests on Wednesday, expanding a major blockade near Nikaia in central Greece that once again forced the closure of the Athens-Thessaloniki motorway, according to local authorities. Read full story

items.title: Cyber Monday Green Deals hub: e-bikes, EVs, power stations, tools, appliances, more [Updated]
items.summary:
We may be past Thanksgiving and the main Black Friday week, but that doesn’t mean the savings train has pulled out of the station just yet, as Cyber Monday sales officially kick into gear. We’re seeing tons of continuing Black Friday sale events extended through today and even the rest of the week. If you haven’t secured your savings on the best Green Deal pricing of the year last week, you’ve got more time to do so, with these holiday savings spanning e-bikes, EVs, power stations, tools, appliances, and much more. We’ve collected everything into this shopping hub for added one-stop convenience, and will continue to update it throughout the week. Head below to check out all the Cyber Monday Green Deals that are alive and well.

items.summary:
Through its official Amazon storefront, Govee is continuing the Black Friday/Cyber Monday pricing we saw on its Matter Tree Floor Lamp for $118.99 shipped. It fetches $170 at full price since releasing back in July, with a few discounts having taken things down to $135 until early Black Friday sales started and first brought the costs down to this rate. It’s been holding strong through the recent shopping holidays with $51 cut from the tag for the lowest price we have tracked.

items.title: Exclusive-Woman suspected by France of spying has ties to Kremlin proxies, social media posts show
items.summary: PARIS/LONDON, Dec 3 (Reuters) - A French-Russian national detained in France on suspicion of espionage has an extensive network of ties with Kremlin proxies, Reuters has found by examining social media posts dating from 2023 until May this year. Read full story

items.summary: HONG KONG, Dec. 3 (Xinhua) -- The anti-China forces who attempt to exploit the deadly fire in the residential complex Wang Fuk Court to disrupt Hong Kong will be brought to justice, the Office for Safeguarding National Security of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) said on Wednesday. items.title: Jackery’s Explorer 1000, 2000, 3000 V2 + 5000 Plus power stations are all hitting new holiday lows from $327
items.summary:
Update 12/03: Not only is Wellbots continuing these exclusive deals for an unknown amount of time longer, but three of the units have dropped even lower in price with our exclusive codes. Prices have been updated below.

Wellbots is undercutting the Black Friday Sale pricing from Jackery on four particular power stations, giving you new low prices during the biggest holiday shopping season. Starting off at the smallest of these units for camping and moving up to whole-home backup companions, you can find the Explorer 1000 V2 Portable Power Station down at $331.55 $326.80 shipped, after using the on-page promo code JACK5 at checkout, which beats out Amazon’s pricing by $17 and Jackery’s direct pricing by $67. It’s been initially dropped from its full $799 price to $349, which goes $17 lower thanks to the bonus savings code, which provides an up to $467 markdown to a new all-time low price. Be sure to check out the other new low prices below while they’re still around.

more…

items.summary:
Over at Amazon, Anker’s official eufy storefront is offering continued Black Friday/Cyber Monday savings on its E15 Robot Lawn Mower at $1,299.99 shipped (beating its direct pricing by $500) and its E18 Robot Lawn Mower at $1,499.99 shipped, which matches its direct pricing. These two advanced robots go for $1,800 and $2,000 directly from the brand, but can more often be found at Amazon down around $1,400 on average (for the E15) and between $1,700 and $1,600 (for the E18). These deals are retaining their recent holiday savings, giving you $100 and $200 markdowns from the going rates ($500 off both MSRPs) for the best continuing prices we have tracked.

items.title: Jackery’s Black Friday/Cyber Monday Encore sale continues up to 65% power station discounts + bonus savings from $79
items.summary:
Following the recent holiday shopping rush, Jackery is giving folks more time to save up to 65% on its power stations with its Black Friday/Cyber Monday Encore Sale, complete with 5% (on orders over $1,500) and 7% (on orders over $2,500) extra savings. One notable deal amongst the bunch is the latest HomePower 3600 Plus Portable Power Station bundled with two 200W solar panels for $1,794.55 shipped, after using the code OFFER5 at checkout for an additional 5% off, beating out Amazon’s pricing by $200. This package would run you $3,699 without any discounts, which we first saw drop to this rate (with the extra savings) during the early and full Black Friday sale events, and otherwise kept above $1,994 the rest of the time since its release in September. You’re getting a combined $1,904 savings back to the best price we have tracked. You’ll also find the standalone HomePower 3600 Plus down at its second-lowest $1,614 pricing with the extra savings code. Head below to get the full lineup of deals while they last through the week.

items.title: Save a whopping $600 on this HP OMEN 16-inch 144Hz gaming laptop with RTX 5050 GPU while it’s down at $799
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Walmart that drops an HP OMEN 16-inch gaming laptop with an RTX 5050 graphics card down to $799.99 shipped. This model typically retails for $1,400 and is currently going for $1,050 directly from HP, meaning Walmart’s offer saves you a solid $600 and comes in $251 cheaper than buying it from HP right now. Unlike the frequently discounted RTX 5060 configuration at Best Buy, this specific variant hasn’t seen many discounts. This is the lowest price we have tracked for it to date, and it’s a great option to consider if you’re looking to buy a capable, reliable gaming notebook without burning a huge hole this holiday season.

items.summary:
Tomorrow is a big day in the fight against parasitic aliens and space pirates everywhere as the brand new Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is finally ready to hit store shelves. Pre-orders are now live at Amazon and other major retailers, but we wanted to quickly highlight the pre-sale deals still available at Costco for folks looking to land a discount before the game launches – it might be a long time before we see any kind of a deal on this one. Costco members can still score the first chance at savings as the Switch version is still down at $52.99 and the Switch 2 Edition is going for $62.99 shipped. Regularly $60 and $70 a pop, these are the best deals we have seen on the big Switch 2 holiday release.

items.title: Lenovo’s Chromebook Duet 11 with keyboard and pen costs less than an iPad Magic Keyboard today at $280 ($120 off)
items.summary:
As part of its extended Cyber Monday deals that are still live delivering deep discounts on laptops, tablets, and more, Lenovo is offering the Chromebook Duet 11 Gen 9 model with 8GB RAM for $279.99 shipped with promo code TECHFEAST1 that auto-applies during checkout. This is regularly a $400 unit, which is now seeing a 30% markdown to save you $120. It’s now matching the lowest price we first tracked for it a couple of months back in September. Lenovo is also throwing in a Folio Keyboard with a stand plus a USI Pen 2 at no extra cost, making this an even sweeter deal. It delivers great value for money considering the entire bundle costs less than Apple’s $289 Magic Keyboard today, which doesn’t even include an iPad. The base model of this Chromebook with 4GB RAM and 64GB eMMC storage is also down to $239.99 shipped, whereas the one with 4GB RAM/128GB storage can be had for $249 shipped. Head below for more details.

items.title: SITE NEWS: How to contact Techmeme about news
items.summary:
Given that our contact points have evolved over the years, here's a general update on how best to tip us, advise us, or complain to us about news. This post is organized around several scenarios, which I'll list in bold.

You want to send an announcement just as an FYI to Techmeme: In the typical scenario, in which you think Techmeme is unlikely to feature the news, or you're not familiar with our criteria for posting, it's best not to do anything. Techmeme only posts about 50 headlines per day and any given announcement is very unlikely to be featured. So save us both time and focus on more fruitful channels than Techmeme.

You want to send news to Techmeme that you think there's a good chance we'll want to post: If you're familiar with Techmeme and anticipate we'll be interested in the story, you can tip the link using this online form. This form integrates into editors' workflow so human editors will see the link in real time. As a bonus, the form requests an email address, enabling us to notify you if we do post the link. For the (hopefully rare) bad actor out there, I need to stress that all submissions are fully vetted by human editors, so any spamming attempt will silently fail.

You want to add a social link underneath news that is already featured on Techmeme: We often feature related blog posts and social posts from LinkedIn, X, Bluesky, Threads, and Mastodon beneath our headlines, and you are encouraged to contribute these links. Just hover over the headline on our desktop page and click the "Add Link Here" button that appears. (For an example, see the image below.) As long as the link you submit adds value in some way, we will add it, and you'll get an email confirming this once we do. Feel free to tip your own links or links from your company, clients, or friends. As long as the link makes Techmeme better, it's a win/win for you and us. (Once again, I must stress that for the rare bad actor, all submissions are fully vetted, and spammy links will not make it to Techmeme.)


You are briefing publications on embargoed news and want to let Techmeme know: Larger companies often give us a heads-up on major announcements, because it helps us post as soon as possible after the embargo and arrange more comprehensive coverage. Because embargoed news isn't public yet, there's no link for it, so you can't submit via our online form. So instead, you can submit details via this special email address. To ease the process for both companies and Techmeme, our policy is to automatically accept embargoed information sent to this email address, meaning we won't publish any information sent to us until it's public. So please don't start off by asking if we accept. Yes, we accept, and have handled embargoes from the biggest tech companies for over a decade without incident. When you email, please include as much detail as you can, including the embargo time, any blog posts or press releases, and specifics on the publications you've briefed. Note that this email address will reach a person who then routes the news to a limited set of editors. (It is not an alias that simply forwards to all editors.) Because of this we request you email 12 or more hours before the embargo time if possible.

Techmeme posted something erroneous or misleading and you want to let us know: Occasionally we flub a headline, or mention a detail from a story that was later corrected unbeknownst to us. In scenarios like this, we definitely want to know so we can fix our headline, or, less commonly, remove or replace our headline, so please use this email address to reach us. Note that you can also use this email address for sending other information or even news tips that can't easily be conveyed by a single URL (making it hard to use this form.) Please note that while we always read these emails, in many cases, we don't have time to reply.

As a bonus, here are a few non-editorial scenarios for contacting us: to place ads on Techmeme, email us here, to inquire about our media monitoring and summary services, email us here, and for matters unrelated to all of the above, use this email address.
